info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 8:49PM CDT until May 23 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...Kansas...
Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County.
Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County.
Marmaton River at Fort Scott affecting Bourbon County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County.
For the Little Osage River...including Fulton, Horton...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton.
* WHEN...Until Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Low lying areas along Route D near Stotesbury flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 38.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 41.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 44.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall tomorrow evening. It will rise to 44.1 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 44.1 feet on 03/15/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 900 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING
